snippet: The suspect in the Washington Navy Yard shooting was stopped from buying an assault rifle last week by a Virginia law prohibiting such sales to out-of-state buyers, officials said.
abstract: Officials say Aaron Alexis, suspect in Washington Navy Yard shooting, was stopped from buying an assault rifle by Virginia law that prohibits sale of such weapons to out-of-state buyers; instead, Alexis bought law-enforcement-style shotgun, which he used to kill 12 people.

byline.contributor: Mike McIntire and Michael Luo contributed from New York.

lead_paragraph: The suspect in the Washington Navy Yard shooting was stopped from buying an assault rifle last week by a Virginia law prohibiting such sales to out-of-state buyers, officials said.

headline.main: State Law Prevented Sale of Assault Rifle to Suspect Last Week, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: State Law Prevented Sale Of Assault Rifle to Suspect Last Week, Officials Say
